description.narrative: Resilient, responsive and inclusive governance and service delivery

participating-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (extrabudgetary contributions only)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Output 2 Civil Society Organizations capacities to monitor and advocate for human rights (including economic and social rights) are strengthened and their knowledge of human rights principles, human rights mechanisms and advocacy skills are sharpened.

Level of capacity and effectiveness of Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) to engage and advocate for human rights Ehanced quality of monitoring, documentation, and reporting on human rights issues including on UPR

target.value: Four additional human rights training of trainers workshops covering organizations not included in the first round of training conducted

actual.value: Citizens participation in democratic governance enhanced through additional training to participate in economic and political processes thereby strengthening socio-economic and political freedom for all. The trainings were instrumental in raising awareness of the ideal governance structure which has led to individuals and /or groups getting opportunities to select structures of their own choice through elections.

target.value: 1. Needs assessment study conducted in conjunction with national baseline assessement to determine levels of understanding of human rights, domestic law and constitutional arrangements that protect and promote human rights in Somalia 2. UNSOM developes training materials, that include relevant human rights, with adult teaching methodologies translated to Somalia language 3.Sensitization on current ongoing government initiatives at Federal and States level have taken place to assist CSO to identify critical human rights focus 4.CSOs from loose and active networks in Federal Member States, are equiped to carry out sensitization and awareness activities at community level

actual.value: Due to the current pandemic and its global effect the engagement was at no cost extended.

target.value: Period monitoring and thematic reports on human rights issues published and start to be widely disseminated 2. UNSOM has provided support to CSOs to develop advocacy strategies as well as messages start to bear fruits with improved advocacy

actual.value: Due to the current pandemic and its global effect the engagement was at no cost extended.

title.narrative: Output 3 CSO alliance enters into constructive partnership with the Federal, Member States, and Somaliland Parliaments to advance human rights issues
Existence of Civil Society Parliament Partnership able to monitor, advocate and align legislation on human rights standards.

target.value: 1.A Civil Society Organization - Parliament Forum is established and human rights champions identified beyond the membership of the Parliamentary Committee on Human Rights 2. The Parliamentary Committee on human rights and gender are strengthened to influence legislation, monitor and provide oversight on human rights issues based on CSOs monitoring reports

actual.value: Due to the current pandemic and its global effect the engagement was at no cost extended.

target.value: 1. UNSOM have conducted 4 training of trainers workshop in Mogadishu, Federal Member States and Somaliland for CSOs and Parliamentary processes including how bills are drafted, processed until they are passed into law 2. CSO will have identified and implemented four priority human rights issues and legislations with support of UNSOM 3. UNSOM have facilitated meeting with Speakers of Parliamentary Committees, Federal Members States and Somaliland 4.CSOs willhave identified influencial Members of Parliament to lobby on relevant areas of human rights and to develop relationships

actual.value: Due to the current pandemic and its global effect the engagement was at no cost extended.

target.value: 1. UNSOM have conducted an additonal four training of trainers workshop in Mogadishu, Federal Member States and Somaliland for CSOs on Parliamentary processes until passed into law 2. UNSOM continue to facilitate access to Speakers of Parliament and relevant committees 3. Confidence and relationship building activities with the newly elected Parliament have been carried out in this year.

actual.value: Overall, Empowered civil society now able to exert pressure on state mechanism and employ different strategies to influence the legislative process. Several trainings and workshop across FGS and FMS; South West State, Galmudug state, Hargeisa, Somaliland, for the staff of the Office of Puntland Human Rights Defenders (OPHRD) in Garowe, south-central Somalia and worked together with other local human rights organisations.

title.narrative: Output 4 Civil Society Organization influence legislations, policies and programmes that are implemented by the Federal Government, Federal Member States and Somaliland to comply with human rights standards.
Number of legislations, policies and programmes developed which are compliant with human rights standards

target.value: 1. Civil Society Organizaitons lobby and advocacy activities have been intensified for identified legislation 2.If legislation is passed, Civil Socieity Organizations review to check whether or not their lobby and advocacy efforts was successful

actual.value: 1.Consultations take place before bills are enacted into law, with increased knowledge, skills, and competence of CSOs in the bill making process evidenced by advocacy on government demanding compliance with international human rights standards. 2.Strengthened recognition of minorities including women and their inclusion in political processes and promoting culture of non-discrimination through raising awareness to combat stigma and discrimination.

target.value: Civil Society Organizations in Mogadishu, Federal Member States, Somaliland are able to engage with Parliament on two new and two existing laws or policies under review

actual.value: Due to the current pandemic and its global effect the engagement was at no cost extended.

target.value: 1. Civil Society Organizations in Mogadishu, Federal Member States, Somaliland have identified 5 priority laws to advocate and lobby to ensure that they are human rights compliant. 2. Civil Society Organizations in Mogadishu, Federal Member States, Somaliland with support of UNSOM have analysised particular laws and policies identified. This analsyis forms part of training to be provided by UNSOM 3. Outreach to communities on relevant legislation to raise awareness and to seek their support commences

actual.value: Due to the current pandemic and its global effect the engagement was at no cost extended.

title.narrative: Output 1 A strong civil society coalition working together to empower communities and to influence laws and policies, which uphold human rights principles is established

A formally established network or coalition through through a signed Memorandum of Understanding, meeting on quarterly basis on substansive advocacy issues such as legislative and policy issues, human rights awareness workshops and conferences, all documented periodically (Quarterly reports)

target.value: 1. Memorandum of Understanding discussions completed and signed by at least 20 Civil Society Organisations 2. A steering committee is elected to administer the alliance on a rotational basis without any renumeration 3. All the Civil Society Organization members of the network are fully trained on operational, programme and management skills and continue to wok on developing the formalised structure to sustain Civil Society Organizations engagment 4. UNSOM secretarial role reduced gradually and is now moving towards an advisory role as the CSO network take on the delivery of programmes including engagement with Parliament without much external support

actual.value: 1. Memorandum of understanding discussions completed, and MOU signed by at least 20 CSOs. 2. A Steering Committee responsible for providing leadership and strategic direction to programmes of the CSOs Forum was formed. 3.UNSOM HRPG training generated capacities and empowerment of civil society which resulted in establishment of different thematic groups or clusters to form a strong coalition dedicated to the UPR process. 4.Human rights and democracy gradually enhanced in Somalia with informed citizens aware of their governance system, building coalitions, taking control of their processes, and working with communities to claim their rights and holding duty bearers accountable to fulfil their obligations. CSOs are making efforts towards participatory development.

target.value: The network starts to be formalised with sensitization and mobilization activities aimed at strengthening the network into a strong alliance

actual.value: Due to the current pandemic and its global effect the engagement was at no cost extended.

target.value: 1. A nationwide baseline assessment completed which will identify key civil society actors and their specific thematic areas in Mogadishu, Federal Member States and Somaliland 2. Draft Memorandum of Understanding developed and comments and views from Civil Society Organizations gathered 3. UNSOM providing secretarial support of the CSO alliance

actual.value: Due to the current pandemic and its global effect the engagement was at no cost extended.

title.narrative: Outcome 1 A strong national human rights focused Civil Society Coaliation (CSO)coaliation working with empowered communities and able to effectively monitor, document and advocate on and for human rights and influence laws and policies established.

Strong and empowered Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) with coordination mechanisms, monitoring, documentation and engagement in UPR implementation in Mogadishu, Federal Member States and Somaliland effectively, engaging authorities and contributing to respect and compliance with human rights.

target.value:
1. An inclusive Civil Society Organizations established in Federal Govt of Somalia, Federal Member States and Somaliland
2. CSO-parliamentary partnerships initiated in Mogadishu, Federal Member States and Somaliland, with clear defined objectives and outcomes 3. The Somali Civil Society Alliance has posively influenced at least 2 enacted pieces of legislation in line with human rights standards and 2 policies adopted in human right areas
